name: Some Assembly Required Trivia Game | Television | 10 Questions

questions.text: What was the name of the toy company that Jarvis won in his lawsuit?
questions.explanation:
Knick Knack Toys.

	In the opening scenes of the pilot Jarvis is given a Knick Knack Toys chemistry set for Christmas. He tosses the set aside to grab for another present and it explodes, destroying his family's house. After a lawsuit (off screen) he is given the entire toy company as payment.

questions.text: After taking over the toy company, what is the first thing Jarvis does as CEO?
questions.explanation:
Install a roller coaster.

	All within the first five minutes of the show, Jarvis wins control of the company and installs a massive roller coaster that wraps in and around the skyscraper the company is housed in. He literally makes reference to the fact that it was his first act as CEO.

questions.text: The show's opening credits are done in a format separate from the regular live-action format of the show. What is it?
options: Black and White, hand drawn animation
questions.explanation:
Claymation.

	The opening credits roll a claymation scene before each episode of the first season. The claymation style animation shows off certain characteristics of each of the show's several main characters.

questions.text: In the pilot the company designs what toy aimed at local second graders?
questions.explanation:
Strongsuit.

	The Strongsuit was about 6 feet tall and was shown to do many things during the episode. The second grader that was using the suit played basketball, rode roller coasters and did other things that she wouldn't have been able to do until she was much taller and stronger.

questions.text: Jarvis' desk is made of a unique material, what is it?
questions.explanation:
Lego building blocks.

	The desk is built with thousands of tiny Lego blocks. It is shown in nearly every scene shot in the CEO's office. In a later episode the desk is pushed aside and breaks into thousands of pieces.

questions.text: The toy company's mascot and alleged founder is shown as a caricature on signs and billboards. What is his name?
questions.explanation:
P. Everett KnickKnack

	P. Everett KnickKnack is shown to be an old white-haired man. He is shown on several signs and logos throughout the show. He is also featured as an animated character in toy commercials shown at the end of each season 1 episode. In several later season one episodes a man claiming to be Mr. KnickKnack shows up for a few story lines.

questions.text: While playing a sport on the roof of the toy company, an artist's pallet is shown to be a part of the game. How is that included in the game?
questions.explanation:
Backboard of a basketball hoop.

	During the first episode when showing off the "Strongsuit" toy they invented several staff members play basketball with the second grade student in the suit. During that game the backboard attached to the hoop is an artist's pallet.

questions.text: The chairs the staff members sit in when they are having a meeting in the lobby are actually what?
questions.explanation:
Stuffed animals.

	There is a massive pile of stuffed animals, each when separated can then be used as a chair. Most of the staff sits in these stuffed animal chairs. In Jarvis' office his chair is also a stuffed animal, but of a different variety. His is a giant monster shaped stuffed animal, the others are more of the cuddly variety.

questions.text: Which member of the toy company staff is actually the former CEO in disguise?
questions.explanation:
Mrs. Bubkes

	Mrs. Bubkes is the foreign janitor who speaks no English, or so the staff believes. In reality she is Candace, the displaced former CEO who is trying to steal back her company.

questions.text: The reception desk at the front of the building is also not a typical desk. What unique design is the desk?
questions.explanation:
Half of a classic car.

	Geneva, the receptionist, sits inside a blue convertible car and uses the modified dash as her desk. In later episodes, jokes about driving around in her desk are made. Geneva is generally lazy and only accepts the job at the company because Jarvis (who has a crush on her) promises that she won't have to do any real work.
